Soy based Spirutein is a good one for women. Many women retain water with the soy based powders. As far as bars in general, there are a million out there. A good one is called "Control Bar" that cmae out of good research from the American Diabetes Association. Good in maintaining steady blood sugar and blood insulin levels for a longer period of time than other bars.
A correction on a misstype in my previous posting: What I meant to type is that most women retain water with the WHEY based powder. In general, men will do well with either one.

My favorite protein bar is from Worldwide Sport Nutritional Supplements, Inc.  They are the ONLY one I have found that have more protein (20 g) than carbohydrate (15 net g), and that don't taste like vitamins to me.  They're not everywhere, but Walgreen's and WalMart have them.  Cheaper at WalMart.I haven't noticed a problem with whey protein powder.For protein drinks, like Sim Fast Low-Carb - but again, hard to find.  Walgreen's and WalMart are the only 2 places.  And again, more protein than carbs - 20 g protein, and 2 net carbs.  Everything else, even those listed for diabetic control have too much carb for me.  I am a diabetic.
